message: Many will agree that the Salae logic analyzer is best-of-class, mainly owing to it's awesome software, at a pricepoint of $150.  http://www.saleae.com/logic/
I was using K's Open Bench Logic Analyzer, which is a great device for $50 (plus cables?)  http://dangerousprototypes.com/docs/Open_Bench_Logic_Sniffer
Looks like some .RU made a generic / knockoff version of the Salae: http://iteadstudio.com/produce/seleae-logic-usbee-ax-usb-blaster/

Los Angles hackerspace Null Space is selling a reference design-based logic analyzer: http://www.nullspacelabs.com/catalog/products.php?5&sid=2h5vrgqpi7ji8dt7gjrc7r44l5  That is compliant with this open source logic analyzer software suite: http://sigrok.org/wiki/Main_Page
